Talon:

Talon calmed down and she nodded and whispered "I know what will ha=
ppen if they caught me"


From: Sandy 
Sent: Tuesday, April 06, 2010 11:18 =
PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's =
come back


  
Tucson holds Talon tenderly beside him. He was not going to =
let anything happen to her. Anyone who dared to touch her wrongfully would =
soon suffer a hurtful wrath if they tried anything.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogro=
ups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Talon:
> 
> Talon embraced him back
> 
=
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Tuesday, April 06, 2010 10:57 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yah=
oogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back
> 
> =

> 
> Tucson embraces her.
> 
> "I'd never do anything to hurt you and if y=
ou don't wish to do that I'm all right with it. I'll just have to fudge it =
somehow."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@> wrote:
> >
> > T=
alon:
> > Talon shook in fear "Dont tell him that I'm here... dont do it...=
 i can set Lord Perseus in danger... i owe him too much... I cant pay him i=
n this way... Please dont ask me to do it"
> > 
> > 
> > From: Sandy 
> > S=
ent: Tuesday, April 06, 2010 10:28 PM
> > To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> > S=
ubject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > OOC=
: I wrote a post, but I dont' know if it went through, if it does come thro=
ugh, just delete the most recent one if it does.
> > 
> > BIC:
> > 
> > Tuc=
son smiles and continues to hold Talon's hand. It was what he hoped to hear=
. Deep down he was hoping that somewhere along the line someone like Nights=
trike could turn over a new leaf. She was proof of it.
> > 
> > " Talon, I'=
m actually happy you told me this. It actually assures me that my intention=
s aren't as crazy as I thought they may seem. Remember when we were fightin=
g Nightstrike? How skilled he appeared to be? He gave us a run for our mone=
y, mainly me, but there was sheer talent in his approach, sheer talent that=
 would not have been at all recognized if I hadn't encountered him. I don't=
 think Unicron would have ever appreciated him for that, instead, he uses h=
im as a puppet to do his dirty work, not at all giving him recognition for =
his efforts. And what does he do when they fail? Disposes of them. But what=
 if someone else, who he thought was an enemy, actually turned out to be a =
friend? You've proven that it can happen, see? It doesn't change how I feel=
 about you. So, this time, I'd like to try a different approach with Nights=
trike. I'd like you to be with me as well as Depthcharge and the others, be=
cause I want them to see the same thing. If we show compassion to those who=
 are otherwise cast asside, because they aren't good enough, we can make fr=
iends out of enemies. Okay, let's go see if this works. It might not."
> > =

> > He escorts Talon outside, holding her hand.
> > 
> > "Okay guys, sorry=
 about that.. I had a slow leak in two tires and I had a heck of a time fin=
ding spares."
> > 
> > Rat Trap nodds.
> > 
> > "Thought so. Kinda is hard =
ta find tires for a big guy like you." 
> > 
> > Tucson now looks to the ot=
hers as he also transmits to Lord Elder.
> > 
> > " First, I'm also transmi=
tting to Lord Elder and Kup, and guys, sorry about earlier, I didn't mean t=
o scare you. Okay, everyone, this is what I hope to accomplish.. Nightstrik=
e may be a minion, but Unicron doesn't value his minions like we value each=
 other. I doubt he's ever been shown appreciation for his talents and abili=
ties. And I have a feeling he's been given false promises. I'd like to try =
and talk to him, on a neutral basis, because even though he doesn't work fo=
r Hydras, he may just have some understanding about Predacon technology tha=
t may come in handy if Night Shift isn't able to get the information on his=
 end, due to the level of risk he's taking. I don't want him to go over his=
 head on something. If he needs to abandon the mission, please, inform him =
that I have nothing against it. In fact, I hope he realizes when it does be=
come too dangerous to pull out. So this way, if he can't get it, at least I=
 might have a chance to get it on my end. I'm begining to think that maybe =
I may have to resort to plan B after all."
> > 
> > Rat Trap swallows.
> > =

> > " So, Night Shift might not make it?"
> > 
> > Tucson shakes his head.=

> > 
> > "I highly doubt it. It was a very risky proposition and I don't k=
now why I even let him do it."
> > 
> > Rat Trap salutes Tucson Prime.
> > =

> > " Tucson Prime, I hereby volunteer my little rat aft ta a call of dang=
erous rescue duty. If I got ya outa there before I can do it for Night Shif=
t."
> > 
> > Tucson looks to him.
> > 
> > "I can't ask you to do that Rat =
Trap. You almost lost your life back there, I can't have that hang over my =
head, absolutely not. We'll see how it plays out. He may be able to get out=
 of there, but if he puts in a distress call, I'll assemble a rescue team f=
or the job. All right, let's do this. Lord Elder, Kup, I will inform you of=
 my status after I've conversed with Nightstrike. Tucson Prime out."
> > 
>=
 > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Talon::
>=
 > > 
> > > Talon smiled and added while her smile turned a bittter one"The=
n the true must be told, cause you deserve it and I love you... My true nam=
e isnt Talon... it was Blacknightmare I was once together mi sister, a Mini=
on... A servant of Unicron... Lord Perseus and Kenzo is awared of my true i=
dentity, and they provided me a sactuary and a new life; Now Tucson,do you =
still love me or do you hate me with all your heart? do you want to know ho=
w I finish in Maximal Side?"
> > > 
> > > 
> > > From: Sandy 
> > > Sent: M=
onday, April 05, 2010 9:43 PM
> > > To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> > > Subje=
ct: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 
> > >=
 Tucson quickly realizes that his com link was still engaged. He gets a sli=
ght startled, but with a very sheepish grin on his face, he tries to answer=
 Lord Elder the best he can.
> > > 
> > > "Oh, Lord Elder, Kup, sorry about=
 that.. I'm fine, nothing's wrong.. Nothing - at all.. I - I.. Um, well, I =
- just got a very strong batch of Energon and it kind of threw me off guard=
.. Caused all sorts of power surges but I assure you I'm no worse for ware.=
 I - was just on my way to Nightstrike when I ran a little low on fuel, so =
I was given something here and it had a few side effects... Look, I'm a lit=
tle tied up right now, I'll definitely get back to you when I have more tim=
e. Tucson Prime out."
> > > 
> > > This time he manages to disengage the co=
m link.
> > > 
> > > "Ohh boy, I sure hope he bought that one. It's not lik=
e me to lie but some things are best kept to ourselves. And this time, I re=
member where I left off."
> > > 
> > > He had not realized it but Tucson wa=
s capable of many emotions, love being one of them.
> > > 
> > > Outside th=
e storage area, Rat Trap tries to cover for Tucson and looks over to the ar=
ea while scratching behind his head.
> > > 
> > > "Hmm, Wheels went inta th=
e storage bay. He could've had ta replace a tire or two and is havn' a hard=
 time lookn' for tires that fit his specs. Isn't too easy findn' wheels for=
 that big guy I bet." 
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston =
Carroll <supercyclonus@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Who: Lord Elder
> > > > Loc=
ation: The Ark's command center
> > > > 
> > > > Lord Elder looked over cur=
iously at Kup as Tuscon completed his
> > > > communcation, his face somewh=
at confused and worried. "Was it is just
> > > > me or did Tuscon sound a b=
it flustered?"
> > > > 
> > > > Elder does a quick sensor reading, and afte=
r a few moments the sensors
> > > > track Tuscon's last radio communication=
 as comming from the area in or
> > > > around the old Maximal base.
> > > =
> 
> > > > It was only then that Lord Elder heard the screeching of tires o=
ver
> > > > the com signal that suddenly cut out.
> > > > 
> > > > "Lord Pe=
rseus, Tuscon, do you require assistance there?" Lord Elder
> > > > said, o=
bviously misreading the whole situation.
> > > > 
> > > > (TAG)
> > > > 
> =
> > > Preston
> > > >
> > >
